comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: So who is the third man, originally captioned Sheriff Henderson?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: For that matter, who are the other two?

comment.author: 61518665@N00
comment._content: Ten to one, the one in the middle is wearing handcuffs.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune., June 20, 1915, Page 2, bottom of column 5 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-06-20/ed-... London, June 19. "The Philadelphia left to-day ... Deputy Sheriff Henderson brought on board Florentino, wanted for a shooting In lllinois." So Bolobilly is right. And this picture would likely have been taken when the Philadelphia docked. But no clues here as to who the other gentleman is.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content:
And that might even be the key to the handcuffs sticking out of the Sheriff's left hand.
I think the fellow's name is Fiorentino, if I read the newspaper correctly.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @artolog: I think you are right that the second letter is "i" not "l"

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content:
Thanks for the newspaper article swanq. We'll change his name to Fiorentino. I think artolog's correct, when you zoom in on the high resolution scan, it looks like a key. 

I tried searching a number of newspaper databases for a Fiorentino wanted for a shooting in 1915 or a few years earlier (in case he had been on the run a while), but I had no luck. Can anyone else figure out who this man is?
